title: Beans Carrots ğŸ¥•  Talimpu | Side Dish
content:
Side dish: South Indian recipe Servings: 4 Super simple and tasty side dish goes well with piping hot rice ğŸšÂ and Chapathi or Phulka. This is also a side for lunch box recipe and kids just love it ğŸ˜ It is the combination of carrots ğŸ¥•Â and beans seasoned with freshly grounded coconut ğŸ¥¥Â and green chillies and finally topped with coriander leaves. I hope you could try this and enjoy ğŸ˜Š Letâ€™s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Carrots - 2 - medium sized - peel off & chop finely
  • Beans - 30 - medium sized- finely chopped
  • Yellow moong Dal - 60 gms - soak in water for 15 mins
  • Fresh coconut - 3 Tb sp
  • Green chillies - 2
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Turmeric Powder - 1/8 tsp
  • Coconut oil - 1 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 5 chopped
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Coriander leaves - 1/3 cup - chopped
Procedure:
  • In a bowl add carrots, beans and soaked moong Dal along with 1/2 teaspoon salt and turmeric powder
  • Cook or steam them
  • They cooked well, then chop curry leaves and coriander leaves
  • In a mixer add green chillies and coconut, make smooth paste
  • Heat a skillet pan over medium heat
  • Add oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds and curry leaves. SautÃ© and add cooked beans and carrots
  • Saute and add grounded paste along with half teaspoon salt. Mix well
  • Let it cook for 2 minutes and turn off heat
  • Finally, add coriander leaves and sautÃ©
  • Serve with hot rice ğŸšÂ or Chapathi
  • Happy cooking and enjoy your day ğŸ‘©ğŸ»â€ğŸ³
